description.narrative: More girls and boys in targeted areas benefit from a safe and enabling learning environment that ensures their resilience to disasters, mitigating adverse impact of climate change

Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More girls and boys in targeted areas benefit from a safe and enabling learning environment that ensures their resilience to disasters, mitigating adverse impact of climate change

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF maintained robust Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) programme to build the capacity of government agencies, nongovernmental organizations and educational facilities to better prepare for and respond to the range of natural disasters that frequently affect the country. UNICEF also continued to work closely with the Government of Tajikistan and REACT national and international partners to reach the most vulnerable children and their families and protect their rights during humanitarian situations. At the policy level, UNICEF supported the development of the Mid-term Programme on Population and Territories Protection in Emergency Situations for 2019-2022. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019

title.narrative: # of schools that practice daily group handwashing as a result of UNICEF direct support and/or leveraged through national programmes
% of schools implementing minimum disaster management and preparedness
# of schools with separate functional sanitation facilities for girls and boys, meeting national standards (SP 4.b.1)
Number of schools implementing safe school protocols (COVID-19 prevention and control) [COVIDSitRep]
Disaster risk reduction/CC adaptation is included in curricula at all levels of education
